Title: the gothowitz deviation

Scene: The apartment kitchen. Penny is cooking breakfast while singing and dancing along to “Man I Feel Like A Woman” by Shenia Twain. Sheldon enters.
of a second normal size human being wouldn’t cause a structural failure, much less a homunculus such as yourself.
A tattoo parlour. Bethany is getting a tattoo.
Sheldon You wouldn’t prefer a throaty chuckle?
The tattoo parlour. Howard is laying down, preparing to have a tattoo on his lower back.
Penny: Morning, Sheldon. Come dance with me.
Why not?
Are you fun in any of them?
All right, want some French toast?
Tell you what, next French Toast Day, I will make you oatmeal.
A homunculus?
Oh, you’re my little homunculus.
Sorry. Okay, who wants syrup and who wants cinnamon sugar?
Yes, well, I want a boyfriend whose roommate isn’t a giant pain in the ass.
You know what, I give up. He’s impossible.
Okay, so Kim the night manager went on maternity leave, and her husband’s name is Sandy, right? So get this, her replacement is a woman named Sandy whose husband’s name is Kim.
I know. What are the odds?
Ooh, Sheldon, it’s as if you don’t think I’ll punch you.
Fine, whatever. Are you finished?
Um, yeah, sure, thanks.
Oh, man, did the Kiss Army repeal don’t ask, don’t tell?
Oh, wow, you’re actually going out like that?
Uh, yeah, I think we’ll pass.
They’re gonna get beaten up at Walgreens. Oh, sorry, Sheldon, I almost sat in your spot.
Thank you.
What’s this cartoon called again?
Anime. You know, I knew a girl in high school named Anna May. Anna May Fletcher. She was born with one nostril. Then she had this bad nose job and basically wound up with three.
Oh, am I talking too much? I’m sorry. Zip.

Yes please. (Her phone rings) Oh. Hey, Kim. Yeah, I… (sees Sheldon looking disapprovingly) You know what, hold on, let me take this in the hall. (Sheldon silently offers her another chocolate. She takes it.) You’ll never guess who they got to replace you at work…
Thank you.
Of course.
Mmm, these are so good
What?
well, my new bed got delivered, if you come over and put it together, you can stay at my place.
Yeah, but if we stay there, we won’t have to be quiet.
Sheldon: No.
Penny, while I subscribe to the many worlds theory which posits the existence of an infinite number of Sheldons in an infinite number of universes, I assure you that in none of them am I dancing.
The math would suggest that in a few I’m a clown made of candy. But I don’t dance.
It’s Oatmeal Day.
Dear Lord, are you still going to be here on French Toast Day?
Look, Leonard, Penny made French toast.
It’s an iCal download, she can put it right in her phone. And I thought we agreed that you’d have your conjugal visits in her apartment.
I see. Did her abysmal housekeeping skills finally trump her perkiness?
That doesn’t seem likely. Her bed’s of sturdy construction. Even the addition
I want oatmeal.
I’m sure that will happen soon enough. But in the meantime, I still want oatmeal.
I can’t be impossible. I exist. I believe what you meant to say is, “I give up, he’s improbable.”
What am I supposed to do, eat French toast on a Monday? Now, that would be impossible.
You can catch even more flies with manure. What’s your point?
Boy, that does smell good. Too bad it’s Monday.

Easily calculable, we begin by identifying the set of married couples with unisex names. We then eliminate those unqualified for restaurant work, the aged, the imprisoned and the limbless, for example. Next we look at…
I’m sorry. Ooh, Penny, it’s as if the Cheesecake Factory is run by witches.
Well, thank you. How thoughtful. Would you like a chocolate
You said be nice to Penny. I believe offering chocolate to someone falls within the definition of nice.
There are more things in heaven and earth, Horatio, than are dreamt of in your philosophy.
You know, I’ve always wanted to go to a goth nighclub.
Bazinga! None of you ever see my practical jokes coming, do you?
Did you? I didn’t notice. Have a chocolate.
And it’s not a cartoon, it’s anime.
You’re here a lot now.
Thank you. Chocolate?
Really?
Very good. Chocolate?
Actually, it turns out I can.

There’s just no pleasing you, is there, Leonard? You weren’t happy with my previous approach to dealing with her, so I decided to employ operant conditioning techniques, building on the work of Thorndike and B.F. Skinner. By this time next week, I believe I can have her jumping out of a pool, balancing a beach ball on her nose.
I’m not suggesting we really make her jump out of a pool. I thought the “bazinga” was implied. I’m just tweaking her personality, sanding off the rough edges if you will.
Are you saying that I’m forbidden from applying a harmless, scientifically valid protocol that will make our lives better?

Obviously, waitressing at the Cheesecake Factory is a complex socioeconomic activity, that requires a great deal of analysis and planning. Bazinga! You know, using positive reinforcement techniques, I could train that behaviour out of her in a week.
If you let me use negative reinforcement, I can get it done before we go to bed.
No, of course not. We’re talking very mild electric shocks. No tissue damage whatsoever.
Oh, come on, you can’t tell me that you’re not intrigued about the possibility of building a better girlfriend.
You mean, like that high-pitched, irritating laugh?
No, that would be incongruous, I was going to lower the whole voice to a more pleasing register.
Come again?
Have a chocolate.
Well, I’m going to make some warm milk and then turn in. I trust if you two are planning in engaging in amorous activites, you’ll keep the decibel level to a minimum.
Thank you. (Throws a chocolate. Penny catches it in her mouth)
Interesting. Sex works even better than chocolate to modify behaviour. I wonder if anyone else has stumbled on to that.
Leonard: Morning.
Sorry. I haven’t given her your schedule yet.
We did, but there were extenuating circumstances.
No, her bed kind of… broke.
Perfectly formed miniature human being.
Don’t do that.
Sheldon, you really need to find a better way of dealing with Penny.
I’m just saying, you can catch more flies with honey than with vinegar.
It’s a… (gives up)
Wow!
Sheldon! it’s an amazing coincidence, can we leave it at that?
Come on, you guys, let it go.
What was that?
It does. But in my experience, you don’t.
Yeah, yeah, now that’s you, obnoxious and insufferable.
Howard, what did you do?
Why are you carrying extras?
In this case, you bet she is.
They’re gonna get beaten up at that club.
Okay, I know what you’re doing.
Yes, you’re using chocolates as positive reinforcement for what you consider correct behaviour.
No, I don’t want any chocolate! Sheldon, you can’t train my girlfriend like a lab rat.
Well, you shouldn’t.
No, this has to stop now.
No, you’re not sanding Penny.
Yes, you’re forbidden.
What could she possibly be talking about for so long?
No.
You’re not squirting her in the face with water.
Forget it.
I’m not. And Penny’s qualities, both good and bad, are what make her who she is.
Yes.
You’re not changing how Penny laughs.
Unbelievable.
I was just thinking, we should probably turn in too.
Really, that’s a lot of work, and it’s kind of late.
Let’s go.
Howard: No. Raj and I are going a goth club in Hollywood to hang with the night people. Anybody want to come along?
No, no. I’m going out like this. (Whips off jacket to reveal tattoos up both arms)

They’re called tattoo sleeves. Look. I bought them online, Raj got a set, too. Fantastic, right? Put them on, have hot sex with some freaky girl with her business pierced, take them off, and I can still be buried in a Jewish cemetery.
Really?
Okay, how about you two? Look, I’ve got some extra tat sleeves.
Well, In case I snag one on someone’s nipple ring.
Oh, is the missus speaking for the couple now?
It’d help if you weren’t drinking light beer.
Hello, it looks like blood. Did you even read the Wiki How link I sent you on being goth?
What?
Just remember we are lost boys, children of the night.
I’m actually much morelost than he is.
Thanks. Can we buy you ladies a drink?
I’m Howard.
Nice to meet you, Bethany.
Oh, you know, goth stuff. Goth magazines, goth music.
Yeah, you know, the dark sciences.
Oy vay.
Does it? Okay, if you like space stuff, I design components for the international space station. Which is in space. Where, as I’m sure you know, no one can hear you scream.
Really? How about that? I’ve been to the Gap.
Okay.
We are fun people.
Did you bring the black condoms?
Let’s go.
Not particularly.
Uh, yeah!
She’s not going to see it. She takes my temperature orally now.
Well, I can’t really decide between a screaming devil, this mean little skull or Kermit the Frog.
You know (Kermit voice) Hi ho, I’m on Howard’s butt!
Yeah, I’d like the mean little skull, please.
Ow, ow, ow, ow, ow!
I know, but it was cold. Ow, ow, ow!
What comes after the stencil?
Aaaaaargh! Okay, that’s it, no needle, no pain, no tattoo.
No, I haven’t, look. (Rips off tattoo sleeves) I’m sorry, I’m a fraud, he’s a fraud.
Yeah, I think I covered that.
We’re not goth, we’re just guys.
Yes. And I wouldn’t blame you if you walked out of here and never wanted to see us again. Unless of course our bold honesty has suddenly made us attractive.
What are you thinking? Maybe a big musical number?
Okay, wait, how about this? We say there were four goth girls, the two girls in the club had two friends.
What’s that got to do with the story?
Fine, they smelled good.
Whatever.
No, no. Look, let me say my story all the way through, and then you can say yours, and then we’ll pick.
Okay. We got tattoos, and then the four girls took us to their place.
We say they’re in a very intimate area.
Right, right, so we go back to their place, and then the six of us end up in a hot tub.
True. Okay, forget the hot tub. The point is, we each have a ménage with sexy goth girls.
Yeah. Hey, want to try a country bar tomorrow night.
Could happen.
Howard (after Raj whispers): Yes, she’s pushy and yes, he’s whipped, but that’s not the expression. Come on, I want to stop at Walgreens and pick up some more eyeliner.
Raj: I think we’re fitting in quite nicely.
Oh, what’s so gothic about vodka and cranberry juice?
No, I’m behind on my wiki-reading I’m kind of on a John Grisham kick right now.
Well, I finished reading The Pelican Brief and loved it so much, I dived right into The Client. He was a lawyer himself so his novels are accurate as well as entertaining.
Great. Lost boys, children of the night. Got it. Can you pass the Chex mix, please. Thank you. We are lost boys.
Light beers? Well, Wiki-how about that?
Raj.
Yes, very nice.
Do either of you ladies enjoy the novels of John Grisham?
Goth food.
Uh… blackened salmon?
Oh, we’re scientists.
Well, I am an astrophysicist and a lot of that takes place at night. When there are vampires and miscellaneous undead out and about.
That sounds really cool.
So what do you gals do?
Yeah, I’ve been there as well. I like your tee-shirts with the little pocket.
Sure, we like fun.
Dark and fun.
In my fanny pack.
Are you happy now?
Are you seriously going to deface your body just for the possibility you could have cheap sex with a strange girl you met in a bar?
What is your mother going to say?
With my luck, hepatitis
We’re both frauds.
But I was summing up.
Very, very smart guys.
When we tell this story, let’s end it differently.
I like it, I like it. Did they smell good despite their gothlike nature?
Engaging my olfactory sense helps make it real for me.
Oh, they did. Like jasmine and honeysuckle.
And then they held hands and did a sexy, demonic hokey-pokey for us.
I’m sorry. Go on.
But we don’t have tattoos. What if someone asks to see our tattoos?
Oh, we are bad boys, aren’t we?
But we just got tattoos. Wouldn’t we be concerned about bacterial infection?
Wow. What a great night.
Yeah, maybe we’ll get lucky with some sexy cowgirls.
I wonder how they smell.
Second girl: I’m Sarah. Not that anyone cares.
Bethany: So what do you guys do?
No, I meant what do you do for jobs?
Yeah. Why don’t we go somewhere else and have some fun?
Come on, I know a place you’ll really dig.
What are you going to get, Howard?
Get the mean little skull, and I’ll see if I can make him smile.
What’s the big deal, you’ve done this before.
So you were totally scamming us?
Sarah: I work there too. Not that anyone cares. You know, this place is boring.
What are you going to get, Raj?
I’m leaving too. Not that anyone cares.
Penny (entering): Uh, sorry guys, that girl is (high pitched) freaky!
